Generation1.name: Bulbasaur
Generation1.description: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this POKéMON.

Generation1.name: Ivysaur
Generation1.description: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

Generation1.name: Venusaur
Generation1.description: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

Generation1.name: Charmander
Generation1.description: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

Generation1.name: Charmeleon
Generation1.description: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.

Generation1.name: Charizard
Generation1.description: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.

Generation1.name: Squirtle
Generation1.description: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

Generation1.name: Wartortle
Generation1.description: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

Generation1.name: Blastoise
Generation1.description: A brutal POKéMON with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.

Generation1.name: Caterpie
Generation1.description: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

Generation1.name: Metapod
Generation1.description: This POKéMON is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

Generation1.name: Butterfree
Generation1.description: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

Generation1.name: Weedle
Generation1.description: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp venomous stinger on its head.

Generation1.name: Kakuna
Generation1.description: Almost incapable of moving, this POKéMON can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

Generation1.name: Beedrill
Generation1.description: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

Generation1.name: Pidgey
Generation1.description: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

Generation1.name: Pidgeotto
Generation1.description: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this POKéMON will fiercely peck at any intruder.

Generation1.name: Pidgeot
Generation1.description: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as MAGIKARP.

Generation1.name: Rattata
Generation1.description: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

Generation1.name: Raticate
Generation1.description: It uses its whis­ kers to maintain its balance. It apparently slows down if they are cut off.

Generation1.name: Spearow
Generation1.description: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.

Generation1.name: Fearow
Generation1.description: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

Generation1.name: Ekans
Generation1.description: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as PIDGEY and SPEAROW, whole.

Generation1.name: Arbok
Generation1.description: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.

Generation1.name: Pikachu
Generation1.description: When several of these POKéMON gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.

Generation1.name: Raichu
Generation1.description: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

Generation1.name: Sandshrew
Generation1.description: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

Generation1.name: Sandslash
Generation1.description: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

Generation1.name: Nidoran-f
Generation1.description: Although small, its venomous barbs render this POKéMON dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

Generation1.name: Nidorina
Generation1.description: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

Generation1.name: Nidoqueen
Generation1.description: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

Generation1.name: Nidoran-m
Generation1.description: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.

Generation1.name: Nidorino
Generation1.description: An aggressive POKéMON that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

Generation1.name: Nidoking
Generation1.description: It uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break the prey's bones.

Generation1.name: Clefairy
Generation1.description: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

Generation1.name: Clefable
Generation1.description: A timid fairy POKéMON that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

Generation1.name: Vulpix
Generation1.description: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.

Generation1.name: Ninetales
Generation1.description: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.

Generation1.name: Jigglypuff
Generation1.description: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

Generation1.name: Wigglytuff
Generation1.description: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

Generation1.name: Zubat
Generation1.description: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.

Generation1.name: Golbat
Generation1.description: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

Generation1.name: Oddish
Generation1.description: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.

Generation1.name: Gloom
Generation1.description: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.

Generation1.name: Vileplume
Generation1.description: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

Generation1.name: Paras
Generation1.description: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by draw­ ing nutrients from the bug host.

Generation1.name: Parasect
Generation1.description: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

Generation1.name: Venonat
Generation1.description: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.

Generation1.name: Venomoth
Generation1.description: The dustlike scales covering its wings are color-coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

Generation1.name: Diglett
Generation1.description: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.

Generation1.name: Dugtrio
Generation1.description: A team of DIGLETT triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

Generation1.name: Meowth
Generation1.description: It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on its forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with Galarian Meowth.

Generation1.name: Persian
Generation1.description: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

Generation1.name: Psyduck
Generation1.description: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily POKéMON will use psychokinetic powers.

Generation1.name: Golduck
Generation1.description: Often seen swim­ ming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

Generation1.name: Mankey
Generation1.description: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.

Generation1.name: Primeape
Generation1.description: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.

Generation1.name: Growlithe
Generation1.description: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

Generation1.name: Arcanine
Generation1.description: A POKéMON that has been admired since the past for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.

Generation1.name: Poliwag
Generation1.description: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.

Generation1.name: Poliwhirl
Generation1.description: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.

Generation1.name: Poliwrath
Generation1.description: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breast stroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

Generation1.name: Abra
Generation1.description: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and TELEPORT to safety.

Generation1.name: Kadabra
Generation1.description: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.

Generation1.name: Alakazam
Generation1.description: Its brain can out­ perform a super­ computer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.

Generation1.name: Machop
Generation1.description: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

Generation1.name: Machoke
Generation1.description: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

Generation1.name: Machamp
Generation1.description: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.

Generation1.name: Bellsprout
Generation1.description: A carnivorous POKéMON that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.

Generation1.name: Weepinbell
Generation1.description: It spits out POISONPOWDER to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of ACID.

Generation1.name: Victreebel
Generation1.description: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

Generation1.name: Tentacool
Generation1.description: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

Generation1.name: Tentacruel
Generation1.description: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

Generation1.name: Geodude
Generation1.description: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

Generation1.name: Graveler
Generation1.description: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

Generation1.name: Golem
Generation1.description: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

Generation1.name: Ponyta
Generation1.description: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.

Generation1.name: Rapidash
Generation1.description: Very competitive, this POKéMON will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

Generation1.name: Slowpoke
Generation1.description: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

Generation1.name: Slowbro
Generation1.description: The SHELLDER that is latched onto SLOWPOKE's tail is said to feed on the host's left over scraps.

Generation1.name: Magnemite
Generation1.description: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses THUNDER WAVE and similar moves.

Generation1.name: Magneton
Generation1.description: Formed by several MAGNEMITEs linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

Generation1.name: Farfetchd
Generation1.description: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.

Generation1.name: Doduo
Generation1.description: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

Generation1.name: Dodrio
Generation1.description: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

Generation1.name: Seel
Generation1.description: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.

Generation1.name: Dewgong
Generation1.description: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

Generation1.name: Grimer
Generation1.description: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

Generation1.name: Muk
Generation1.description: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

Generation1.name: Shellder
Generation1.description: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

Generation1.name: Cloyster
Generation1.description: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

Generation1.name: Gastly
Generation1.description: Almost invisible, this gaseous POKéMON cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

Generation1.name: Haunter
Generation1.description: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from an­ other dimension.

Generation1.name: Gengar
Generation1.description: Under a full moon, this POKéMON likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

Generation1.name: Onix
Generation1.description: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.

Generation1.name: Drowzee
Generation1.description: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.

Generation1.name: Hypno
Generation1.description: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as HYPNOSIS and CONFUSION.

Generation1.name: Krabby
Generation1.description: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.

Generation1.name: Kingler
Generation1.description: The large pincer has 10000 hp of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.

Generation1.name: Voltorb
Generation1.description: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a POKé BALL, they have zapped many people.

Generation1.name: Electrode
Generation1.description: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

Generation1.name: Exeggcute
Generation1.description: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

Generation1.name: Exeggutor
Generation1.description: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an EXEGGCUTE.

Generation1.name: Cubone
Generation1.description: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this POKéMON's real face.

Generation1.name: Marowak
Generation1.description: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.

Generation1.name: Hitmonlee
Generation1.description: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

Generation1.name: Hitmonchan
Generation1.description: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning fast volleys that are impossible to see.

Generation1.name: Lickitung
Generation1.description: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.

Generation1.name: Koffing
Generation1.description: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.

Generation1.name: Weezing
Generation1.description: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, 2 KOFFINGs can fuse into a WEEZING over many years.

Generation1.name: Rhyhorn
Generation1.description: A POKéMON with a one-track mind. Once it charges,  it won't stop running until it falls asleep.

Generation1.name: Rhydon
Generation1.description: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees.

Generation1.name: Chansey
Generation1.description: A rare and elusive POKéMON that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.

Generation1.name: Tangela
Generation1.description: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to sea­ weed. Its vines shake as it walks.

Generation1.name: Kangaskhan
Generation1.description: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is 3 years old.

Generation1.name: Horsea
Generation1.description: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

Generation1.name: Seadra
Generation1.description: Capable of swim­ ming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

Generation1.name: Goldeen
Generation1.description: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen.

Generation1.name: Seaking
Generation1.description: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

Generation1.name: Staryu
Generation1.description: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.

Generation1.name: Starmie
Generation1.description: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.

Generation1.name: Mr-mime
Generation1.description: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.

Generation1.name: Scyther
Generation1.description: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.

Generation1.name: Jynx
Generation1.description: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

Generation1.name: Electabuzz
Generation1.description: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

Generation1.name: Magmar
Generation1.description: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

Generation1.name: Pinsir
Generation1.description: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard.

Generation1.name: Tauros
Generation1.description: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

Generation1.name: Magikarp
Generation1.description: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

Generation1.name: Gyarados
Generation1.description: Once it begins to rampage, a GYARADOS will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

Generation1.name: Lapras
Generation1.description: A POKéMON that has been over­ hunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water.

Generation1.name: Ditto
Generation1.description: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

Generation1.name: Eevee
Generation1.description: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element STONEs.

Generation1.name: Vaporeon
Generation1.description: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

Generation1.name: Jolteon
Generation1.description: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10000- volt lightning bolts.

Generation1.name: Flareon
Generation1.description: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.

Generation1.name: Porygon
Generation1.description: A POKéMON that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

Generation1.name: Omanyte
Generation1.description: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

Generation1.name: Omastar
Generation1.description: A prehistoric POKéMON that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible to catch prey.

Generation1.name: Kabuto
Generation1.description: A POKéMON that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

Generation1.name: Kabutops
Generation1.description: Its sleek shape is perfect for swim­ ming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

Generation1.name: Aerodactyl
Generation1.description: A Pokémon that roamed the skies in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are like saw blades.

Generation1.name: Snorlax
Generation1.description: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

Generation1.name: Articuno
Generation1.description: A legendary bird POKéMON that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

Generation1.name: Zapdos
Generation1.description: A legendary bird POKéMON that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.

Generation1.name: Moltres
Generation1.description: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

Generation1.name: Dratini
Generation1.description: Long considered a mythical POKéMON until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.

Generation1.name: Dragonair
Generation1.description: A mystical POKéMON that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.

Generation1.name: Dragonite
Generation1.description: An extremely rarely seen marine POKéMON. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

Generation1.name: Mewtwo
Generation1.description: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

Generation1.name: Mew
Generation1.description: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
